favourite.article: What they have poured upon the Lord is not a waste but a fragrant testimony of His sweetness.
Amen, Lord. Make me vital, Lord. Even though I'm in weakness but You are here always guiding me. PTL!

Amen. The Lord give Himself for us. Because of His great love toward us, He died for us to redeem us and we receive His very own life. Now we must love Him in return, giving all of our lives and seek to pursue Him whatever may happen....OH LORD JESUS I DO LOVE YOU VERY VERY VERY MUCH..
Praise the Lord! What we have poured upon Him is not wasted.
What I have and will pour upon the Lord will never be a waste.
Amen. We should consecrate ourselves to the Lord...
Amen.
Amen.
I was refreshed with my consecration in this song. In myself, I'm not really faithful but He is so faithful. Lord may you draw me more. Make me willing. I love You Lord.
Whenever we give everything from us for the Lord including ourselves, our whole being, and everything for the Lord's.

Whenever we give everything from us for the Lord including ourselves, the people in the world will say "what a waste?!". yet for the Lord it is a sweet fragrance that becomes a testimony of the Lord's love that constrains us to love Him back. "Lord make us like the wise virgins who redeemed the time gaining you and loving You. Lord until Your coming back may Your love constrains us.

Apostle Paul considers all things dung because he saw the preciousness of the Lord. And those around us would never imagined that our pouring to the Lord is full of worth rather they will consider it as a "waste". But for us who love the Lord dearly, are willing to waste and be wasted just for the Lord because we know that our consecrating and pouring to Him is not our favor to Him but a privilege that we can give ourselves. Lord, we want to pour more. Draw us more closer to see Your preciousness.
Amen! Let's all "waste" ourselves and our everything upon the Lord! :)
Our labor is not vain in the Lord. Amen.
The Lord is altogether lovely and worthy of our offerings! It is not really a waste to pour our all to our dear Lord Jesus!
This is a really nice hymn! Does anybody knows its Chinese title or Chinese lyrics? Thanks!
What we have poured upon him now is NOT WASTED, but a fragrant testimony of his own sweetness.
May we have an intimate relationship with the Lord. And then from the hidden depths within us we will pour out our best on Him alone.

Those who have tasted and experienced the Lord's sweetness will testify on this by pouring everything upon the Lord. It is not a waste but a fragrant testimony to the Lord's sweetness. Lord Jesus I love You!
Lord, dearest Lord... this is not a waste. You are altogether lovely and worthy of our offering.

Our Lord is truly lovely. All things are dung compared to Him. He is an unfathomable treasure. How we need to give Him the first place in all things and the best love for Him.
Today is the best time to anoint our Lord, while we are waiting for His second coming, we need to spend time to pour out ourselves upon Him. Amen.

Though the world would consider it a waste of our pouring of our everything to our precious Lord, it is a fragrant testimony of His sweetness. With our continuous consecration to Him others would smell His fragrance from us. This is a wonderful testimony to the world. May we reach to the point of saying to the Lord, "Lord, for Your sake there's no one thing that I would not forsake, even my life." Amen.
Nice song.

Nothing is too much for the Lord. He is altogether lovely and worthy of our offering. May the Lord cause us to see more of His preciousness that we may no longer think of our offering - our life, service, love - as a waste but as a fragrant testimony of His sweetness. Amen.

Amen! Praise the Lord! To those who love Lord, it is fitting to set aside everything and consecrate ourselves to the Lord. Such a wonderful experience and enjoyment whenever we are abiding in the Lord.
We all need to count all things as loss on account of Christ. Lord Jesus, help me each day to "waste" my life and all on You. I want to Lord, I love You.

This 'new song' is an encouragement to all of us who loves the Lord. This is very meaningful and filled with sentiments with deep impact to all those who are serving the Lord and to those who wants to serve Him. Amen.
Thanks You Lord Jesus. I love You so much.
Lord, I willingly give myself to You. Lord, I love You!

Amen! For a long time, I have a strong desire to study how to sing this song. It touches me very deeply. I want be one of those who loved Him in such a way. What we have poured upon Him is not a "waste" but a fragrant testimony. Lord, give me a heart to count all things in this world as loss but only Christ gained. Dear Lord, draw me to love You more and more each day! Praying for that someone can teach me sing this wonderful song. Thank you! lordspete@gmail.com

Many may see our service as a "waste" as we could be doing "profitable" things or even just have a good time. But to me and to all those who genuinely love the Lord, to pour ourselves in the church life is the greatest joy on earth. My life is full of meaning. Praise the Lord for the spirit of wisdom and revelation that has unveiled our eyes and our hearts.
